title: Strategic Utilization of Large Language Models (LLMs) for Mathematics Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts and General Instructional Design
context.additional_context: A process exploring the applicability of problem-chain-based instructional design frameworks to LLM-driven math education design. Blends online (theory/case analysis) and offline (practice/feedback) activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core components of a problem-chain-based instructional design framework
Learners can design high school-level mathematical problem chains using LLMs
Learners can statistically compare the strengths and limitations of LLM-generated instructional designs
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
